data.fullContent: Film acting used to involve memorizing lines as well as acting. Actors weren't allowed to have scripts with them while filming because they were supposed to have memorized their lines well in advance. Such was the way of the film actors. Not anymore; most actors have come to rely on teleprompters to show them their lines during filming. Some actors, however, still hold on to the tradition of memorizing their lines and performing without the aid of a teleprompter. These actors' performances are often seen as being less stiff and more realistic than those who rely on teleprompters.
